values.authorQuote: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.

values.authorQuote: My message, especially to young people is to have courage to think differently, courage to invent, to travel the unexplored path, courage to discover the impossible and to conquer the problems and succeed. These are great qualities that they must work towards. This is my message to the young people.

values.author: Albert Einstein

values.authorQuote: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
values.author: Albert Einstein
values.authorBirthplace: Ulm, Kingdom of Württemberg, German Empire

values.authorQuote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
values.author: Albert Einstein
values.authorBirthplace: Ulm, Kingdom of Württemberg, German Empire

values.authorQuote: It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer.
values.author: Albert Einstein
values.authorBirthplace: Ulm, Kingdom of Württemberg, German Empire

values.authorQuote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: There are two means of refuge from the miseries of life: music and cats.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Happiness is nothing more than good health and a bad memory.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Sometimes our light goes out but is blown into flame by another human being. Each of us owes deepest thanks to those who have rekindled this light.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: One who gains strength by overcoming obstacles possesses the only strength which can overcome adversity.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: The first step in the evolution of ethics is a sense of solidarity with other human beings.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: The willow which bends to the tempest, often escapes better than the oak which resists it; and so in great calamities, it sometimes happens that light and frivolous spirits recover their elasticity and presence of mind sooner than those of a loftier character.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Example is leadership.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Let me give you a definition of ethics: It is good to maintain and further life it is bad to damage and destroy life.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Ethics is nothing else than reverence for life.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Just as the wave cannot exist for itself, but is ever a part of the heaving surface of the ocean, so must I never live my life for itself, but always in the experience which is going on around me.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Until he extends his circle of compassion to include all living things, man will not himself find peace.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: We are all so much together, but we are all dying of loneliness.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: An optimist is a person who sees a green light everywhere, while a pessimist sees only the red stoplight... the truly wise person is colorblind.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Compassion, in which all ethics must take root, can only attain its full breadth and depth if it embraces all living creatures and does not limit itself to mankind.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: Do not let Sunday be taken from you. If your soul has no Sunday, it becomes an orphan.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: One truth stands firm. All that happens in world history rests on something spiritual. If the spiritual is strong, it creates world history. If it is weak, it suffers world history.
values.author: Albert Schweitzer
values.authorOccupation: Theologian, organist, writer, humanitarian, philosopher, physician

values.authorQuote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: You shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you mad.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: The most valuable of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it has to be done, whether you like it or not.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Speed provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: One of the great attractions of patriotism - it fulfills our worst wishes. In the person of our nation we are able, vicariously, to bully and cheat. Bully and cheat, what's more, with a feeling that we are profoundly virtuous.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Experience teaches only the teachable.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: A democracy which makes or even effectively prepares for modern, scientific war must necessarily cease to be democratic. No country can be really well prepared for modern war unless it is governed by a tyrant, at the head of a highly trained and perfectly obedient bureaucracy.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: You should hurry up and acquire the cigar habit. It's one of the major happinesses. And so much more lasting than love, so much less costly in emotional wear and tear.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth. By simply not mentioning certain subjects... totalitarian propagandists have influenced opinion much more effectively than they could have by the most eloquent denunciations.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: The propagandist's purpose is to make one set of people forget that certain other sets of people are human.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Your true traveller finds boredom rather agreeable than painful. It is the symbol of his liberty - his excessive freedom. He accepts his boredom, when it comes, not merely philosophically, but almost with pleasure.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Like every man of sense and good feeling, I abominate work.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: There's only one effectively redemptive sacrifice, the sacrifice of self-will to make room for the knowledge of God.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Most ignorance is vincible ignorance. We don't know because we don't want to know.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: The impulse to cruelty is, in many people, almost as violent as the impulse to sexual love - almost as violent and much more mischievous.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: My fate cannot be mastered; it can only be collaborated with and thereby, to some extent, directed. Nor am I the captain of my soul; I am only its noisiest passenger.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: Hell isn't merely paved with good intentions; it's walled and roofed with them. Yes, and furnished too.
values.author: Aldous Huxley

values.authorQuote: There is a certain enthusiasm in liberty, that makes human nature rise above itself, in acts of bravery and heroism.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: A well adjusted person is one who makes the same mistake twice without getting nervous.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: A promise must never be broken.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: I never expect to see a perfect work from an imperfect man.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: The sacred rights of mankind are not to be rummaged for among old parchments or musty records. They are written, as with a sunbeam, in the whole volume of human nature, by the hand of the divinity itself; and can never be erased.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Real liberty is neither found in despotism or the extremes of democracy, but in moderate governments.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: To all general purposes we have uniformly been one people, each individual citizen everywhere enjoying the same national rights, privileges, and protection.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Unless your government is respectable, foreigners will invade your rights; and to maintain tranquillity, it must be respectable - even to observe neutrality, you must have a strong government.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: When the sword is once drawn, the passions of men observe no bounds of moderation.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: You should not have taken advantage of my sensibility to steal into my affections without my consent.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Even to observe neutrality you must have a strong government.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: The voice of the people has been said to be the voice of God; and, however generally this maxim has been quoted and believed, it is not true to fact. The people are turbulent and changing, they seldom judge or determine right.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: It's not tyranny we desire; it's a just, limited, federal government.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Men often oppose a thing merely because they have had no agency in planning it, or because it may have been planned by those whom they dislike.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: I think the first duty of society is justice.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Men are rather reasoning than reasonable animals, for the most part governed by the impulse of passion.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: The nation which can prefer disgrace to danger is prepared for a master and deserves one.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Real firmness is good for anything; strut is good for nothing.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: It is the advertiser who provides the paper for the subscriber. It is not to be disputed, that the publisher of a newspaper in this country, without a very exhaustive advertising support, would receive less reward for his labor than the humblest mechanic.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: A national debt, if it is not excessive, will be to us a national blessing.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: There are seasons in every country when noise and impudence pass current for worth; and in popular commotions especially, the clamors of interested and factious men are often mistaken for patriotism.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Safety from external danger is the most powerful director of national conduct. Even the ardent love of liberty will, after a time, give way to its dictates.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Learn to think continentally.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Power over a man's subsistence is power over his will.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: Why has government been instituted at all? Because the passions of men will not conform to the dictates of reason and justice, without constraint.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: The honor of a nation is its life.
values.author: Alexander Hamilton
values.authorOccupation: United States Secretary of the Treasury

values.authorQuote: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: The greatest magnifying glasses in the world are a man's own eyes when they look upon his own person.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Teach me to feel another's woe, to hide the fault I see, that mercy I to others show, that mercy show to me.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: No woman ever hates a man for being in love with her, but many a woman hate a man for being a friend to her.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: A little learning is a dangerous thing; Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: The difference is too nice - Where ends the virtue or begins the vice.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: On wrongs swift vengeance waits.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: The ruling passion, be it what it will. The ruling passion conquers reason still.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Pride is still aiming at the best houses: Men would be angels, angels would be gods. Aspiring to be gods, if angels fell; aspiring to be angels men rebel.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: All nature is but art unknown to thee.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: On life's vast ocean diversely we sail. Reasons the card, but passion the gale.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Some people will never learn anything, for this reason, because they understand everything too soon.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Histories are more full of examples of the fidelity of dogs than of friends.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: No one should be ashamed to admit they are wrong, which is but saying, in other words, that they are wiser today than they were yesterday.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: And, after all, what is a lie? 'Tis but the truth in a masquerade.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: How happy is the blameless vestal's lot? The world forgetting, by the world forgot.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed was the ninth beatitude.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Lulled in the countless chambers of the brain, our thoughts are linked by many a hidden chain; awake but one, and in, what myriads rise!
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Remembrance and reflection how allied. What thin partitions divides sense from thought.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: All are but parts of one stupendous whole, Whose body Nature is, and God the soul.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: The way of the Creative works through change and transformation, so that each thing receives its true nature and destiny and comes into permanent accord with the Great Harmony: this is what furthers and what perseveres.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: True ease in writing comes from art, not chance, as those move easiest who have learn'd to dance.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: Praise undeserved, is satire in disguise.
values.author: Alexander Pope

values.authorQuote: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Remember upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: I am indebted to my father for living, but to my teacher for living well.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Heaven cannot brook two suns, nor earth two masters.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: I am dying from the treatment of too many physicians.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: How great are the dangers I face to win a good name in Athens.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Whatever possession we gain by our sword cannot be sure or lasting, but the love gained by kindness and moderation is certain and durable.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: I had rather excel others in the knowledge of what is excellent, than in the extent of my power and dominion.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: If I were not Alexander, I would be Diogenes.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: I do not pilfer victory.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: For my own part, I would rather excel in knowledge of the highest secrets of philosophy than in arms.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: How happy had it been for me had I been slain in the battle. It had been far more noble to have died the victim of the enemy than fall a sacrifice to the rage of my friends.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Who does not desire such a victory by which we shall join places in our Kingdom, so far divided by nature, and for which we shall set up trophies in another conquered world?
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: You shall, I question not, find a way to the top if you diligently seek for it; for nature hath placed nothing so high that it is out of the reach of industry and valor.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: If we turn our backs of the Scythians who have provoked us, how shamefully shall we march against the revolted Bactrians; but if we pass Tanais and make the Scythians feel, by dear experience, that we are invincible, not in Asia only, it is not to be doubted but that Europe itself, as well as Asia, will come within the bounds of our conquests.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: So far as I am concerned, I could not be accused of having set eyes, or having wished to set eyes, upon Darius' wife: on the contrary, I have refused even to listen to those who spoke to me of her beauty.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Soldiers, I had lately like to have been taken from you by the attempt of a few desperate men, but by the grace and providence of the gods, I am still preserved.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: How should a man be capable of grooming his own horse, or of furbishing his own spear and helmet, if he allows himself to become unaccustomed to tending even his own person, which is his most treasured belonging?
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: My father will anticipate everything. He will leave you and me no chance to do a great and brilliant deed.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: I wish that the Indians believed me a god, for upon the report of an enemy's valor oftentimes depends the success of a battle, and false reports have many times done as great things as true courage and resolution.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Oh! Most miserable wretch that I am! Why have I not learnt how to swim?
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: His father is governor of Media, and though he has the greatest command given him of all the rest of my generals, he still covetously desires more, and my being without issue spurs him on to this wicked design. But Philotas takes wrong measures.
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Shall I, that have destroyed my Preservers, return home?
values.author: Alexander the Great
values.authorOccupation: King of the ancient Greek Kingdom of Macedon

values.authorQuote: Liberty cannot be established without morality, nor morality without faith.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The American Republic will endure until the day Congress discovers that it can bribe the public with the public's money.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: Democracy and socialism have nothing in common but one word, equality. But notice the difference: while democracy seeks equality in liberty, socialism seeks equality in restraint and servitude.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The greatness of America lies not in being more enlightened than any other nation, but rather in her ability to repair her faults.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: As one digs deeper into the national character of the Americans, one sees that they have sought the value of everything in this world only in the answer to this single question: how much money will it bring in?
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The French want no-one to be their superior. The English want inferiors. The Frenchman constantly raises his eyes above him with anxiety. The Englishman lowers his beneath him with satisfaction.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The main business of religions is to purify, control, and restrain that excessive and exclusive taste for well-being which men acquire in times of equality.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: History is a gallery of pictures in which there are few originals and many copies.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: Life is to be entered upon with courage.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: A democratic government is the only one in which those who vote for a tax can escape the obligation to pay it.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: When the past no longer illuminates the future, the spirit walks in darkness.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: Americans are so enamored of equality that they would rather be equal in slavery than unequal in freedom.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: Grant me thirty years of equal division of inheritances and a free press, and I will provide you with a republic.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: In other words, a democratic government is the only one in which those who vote for a tax can escape the obligation to pay it.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: There are many men of principle in both parties in America, but there is no party of principle.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The genius of democracies is seen not only in the great number of new words introduced but even more in the new ideas they express.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: What is most important for democracy is not that great fortunes should not exist, but that great fortunes should not remain in the same hands. In that way there are rich men, but they do not form a class.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: In the United States, the majority undertakes to supply a multitude of ready-made opinions for the use of individuals, who are thus relieved from the necessity of forming opinions of their own.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: I know of no country in which there is so little independence of mind and real freedom of discussion as in America.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: He was as great as a man can be without morality.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The health of a democratic society may be measured by the quality of functions performed by private citizens.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: Those that despise people will never get the best out of others and themselves.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: I cannot help fearing that men may reach a point where they look on every new theory as a danger, every innovation as a toilsome trouble, every social advance as a first step toward revolution, and that they may absolutely refuse to move at all.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: The surface of American society is covered with a layer of democratic paint, but from time to time one can see the old aristocratic colours breaking through.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: In politics shared hatreds are almost always the basis of friendships.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: It is the dissimilarities and inequalities among men which give rise to the notion of honor; as such differences become less, it grows feeble; and when they disappear, it will vanish too.
values.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
values.authorBirthname: Alexis Charles Henri Clérel de Tocqueville

values.authorQuote: 'Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Better not be at all than not be noble.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: My strength is as the strength of ten, because my heart is pure.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Guard your roving thoughts with a jealous care, for speech is but the dealer of thoughts, and every fool can plainly read in your words what is the hour of your thoughts.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: There lives more faith in honest doubt, believe me, than in half the creeds.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Ours not to reason why, ours but to do and die.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: All experience is an arch wherethrough gleams that untravelled world whose margin fades for ever and for ever when I move.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: And out of darkness came the hands that reach thro' nature, moulding men.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Let the great world spin for ever down the ringing grooves of change.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Theirs is not to make reply: Theirs is not to reason why: Theirs is but to do and die.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: No man ever got very high by pulling other people down. The intelligent merchant does not knock his competitors. The sensible worker does not knock those who work with him. Don't knock your friends. Don't knock your enemies. Don't knock yourself.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: I am a part of all that I have met.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Love is the only gold.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Ring out the false, ring in the true.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: A lie which is half a truth is ever the blackest of lies.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: So many worlds, so much to do, so little done, such things to be.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: I must lose myself in action, lest I wither in despair.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: The Gods themselves cannot recall their gifts.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: Tis not too late to seek a newer world.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: We cannot be kind to each other here for even an hour. We whisper, and hint, and chuckle and grin at our brother's shame; however you take it we men are a little breed.
values.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

values.authorQuote: In nature, nothing is perfect and everything is perfect. Trees can be contorted, bent in weird ways, and they're still beautiful.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: In search of my mother's garden, I found my own.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: 'Thank you' is the best prayer that anyone could say. I say that one a lot. Thank you expresses extreme gratitude, humility, understanding.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Life is abundant, and life is beautiful. And it's a good place that we're all in, you know, on this earth, if we take care of it.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: This is a wonderful planet, and it is being completely destroyed by people who have too much money and power and no empathy.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: I have fallen in love with the imagination. And if you fall in love with the imagination, you understand that it is a free spirit. It will go anywhere, and it can do anything.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: In South Korea, they believe that when you turn 60, you've become a baby again and the rest of your life should be totally about joy and happiness, and people should leave you alone, and I just think that that's the height of intelligence.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: As you know from school, it's when you have not prepared for the test that you have the fear of failing. And if you have prepared, even if you fail, you've done your best.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: How simple a thing it seems to me that to know ourselves as we are, we must know our mothers names.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: War contributes greatly to global warming, which shouldn't surprise us. All those bombs going off, all those rockets, all those planes and helicopters. All that fuel of various kinds being used. It pollutes the air and water of this very fragile and interconnected planet.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: I'm entirely interested in people, and also other creatures and beings, but especially in people, and I tend to read them by emotional field more than anything. So I have a special interest in what they're thinking and who they are and who's hiding behind those eyes and how did he get there, and what's the story, really?
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Womanist is to feminist as purple is to lavender.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: People do not wish to appear foolish; to avoid the appearance of foolishness, they are willing to remain actually fools.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Poetry is the lifeblood of rebellion, revolution, and the raising of consciousness.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Nobody is as powerful as we make them out to be.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: The fact is that when you do something from your heart, you leave a heart print.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Yes, Mother. I can see you are flawed. You have not hidden it. That is your greatest gift to me.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: I grew up in the South under segregation. So, I know what terrorism feels like - when your father could be taken out in the middle of the night and lynched just because he didn't look like he was in an obeying frame of mind when a white person said something he must do. I mean, that's terrorism, too.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: It is because I recognize the brutality with which my own multi-branched ancestors have been treated that I can identify the despicable, lawless, cruel, and sadistic behavior that has characterized Israel's attempts to erase a people, the Palestinians, from their own land.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: I consider the fact that thousands of children die each day from starvation and a lack of medicine a crisis for humanity and a problem we must collectively attempt to solve.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: It is justice and respect that I want the world to dust off and put - without delay, and with tenderness - back on the head of the Palestinian child. It will be imperfect justice and respect because the injustice and disrespect have been so severe. But I believe we are right to try.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: In my work and in myself I reflect black people, women and men, as I reflect others. One day even the most self-protective ones will look into the mirror I provide and not be afraid.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: If you deny people their own voice, you'll have no idea of who they were.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Is solace anywhere more comforting than that in the arms of a sister.
values.author: Alice Walker
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist

values.authorQuote: Bride: A woman with a fine prospect of happiness behind her.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Spring beckons! All things to the call respond; the trees are leaving and cashiers abscond.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: War is God's way of teaching Americans geography.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Politics: A strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles. The conduct of public affairs for private advantage.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is - it is her shadow.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Suffrage, noun. Expression of opinion by means of a ballot. The right of suffrage (which is held to be both a privilege and a duty) means, as commonly interpreted, the right to vote for the man of another man's choice, and is highly prized.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Cynic, n: a blackguard whose faulty vision sees things as they are, not as they ought to be.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Conservative, n: A statesman who is enamored of existing evils, as distinguished from the Liberal who wishes to replace them with others.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Future. That period of time in which our affairs prosper, our friends are true and our happiness is assured.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Sweater, n.: garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Laziness. Unwarranted repose of manner in a person of low degree.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Childhood: the period of human life intermediate between the idiocy of infancy and the folly of youth - two removes from the sin of manhood and three from the remorse of age.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: The hardest tumble a man can make is to fall over his own bluff.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Jealous, adj. Unduly concerned about the preservation of that which can be lost only if not worth keeping.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Saint: A dead sinner revised and edited.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Divorce: a resumption of diplomatic relations and rectification of boundaries.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Egotist: a person more interested in himself than in me.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Immortality: A toy which people cry for, And on their knees apply for, Dispute, contend and lie for, And if allowed Would be right proud Eternally to die for.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Alliance - in international politics, the union of two thieves who have their hands so deeply inserted in each other's pockets that they cannot separately plunder a third.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Love: A temporary insanity curable by marriage.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Cabbage: a familiar kitchen-garden vegetable about as large and wise as a man's head.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: A total abstainer is one who abstains from everything but abstention, and especially from inactivity in the affairs of others.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: What this country needs what every country needs occasionally is a good hard bloody war to revive the vice of patriotism on which its existence as a nation depends.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: An egotist is a person of low taste - more interested in himself than in me.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: Happiness: an agreeable sensation arising from contemplating the misery of another.
values.author: Ambrose Bierce

values.authorQuote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Flying might not be all plain sailing, but the fun of it is worth the price.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Women, like men, should try to do the impossible. And when they fail, their failure should be a challenge to others.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: I want to do it because I want to do it.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Never do things others can do and will do if there are things others cannot do or will not do.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: The woman who can create her own job is the woman who will win fame and fortune.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Among all the marvels of modern invention, that with which I am most concerned is, of course, air transportation. Flying is perhaps the most dramatic of recent scientific attainment. In the brief span of thirty-odd years, the world has seen an inventor's dream first materialized by the Wright brothers at Kitty Hawk become an everyday actuality.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Aviation, this young modern giant, exemplifies the possible relationship of women and the creations of science. Although women have not taken full advantage of its use and benefits, air travel is as available to them as to men.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: I have often said that the lure of flying is the lure of beauty.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail their failure must be but a challenge to others.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: There are two kinds of stones, as everyone knows, one of which rolls.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Please know that I am aware of the hazards. I want to do it because I want to do it. Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail, their failure must be a challenge to others.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: In soloing - as in other activities - it is far easier to start something than it is to finish it.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: I have often been asked what I think about at the moment of take-off. Of course, no pilot sits and feels his pulse as he flies. He has to be part of the machine. If he thinks of anything but the task in hand, then trouble is probably just around the corner.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Women must pay for everything. They do get more glory than men for comparable feats, but, they also get more notoriety when they crash.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Better do a good deed near at home than go far away to burn incense.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: There is so much that must be done in a civilized barbarism like war.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Obviously I faced the possibility of not returning when first I considered going. Once faced and settled there really wasn't any good reason to refer to it.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Aviation offered such fun as crossing the continent in planes large and small, trying the whirling rotors of an autogiro, making record flights. With these activities came opportunity to know women everywhere who shared my conviction that there is so much women can do in the modern world and should be permitted to do irrespective of their sex.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Mostly, my flying has been solo, but the preparation for it wasn't. Without my husband's help and encouragement, I could not have attempted what I have. Ours has been a contented and reasonable partnership, he with his solo jobs and I with mine. But always with work and play together, conducted under a satisfactory system of dual control.
values.author: Amelia Earhart

values.authorQuote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: A leaf fluttered in through the window this morning, as if supported by the rays of the sun, a bird settled on the fire escape, joy in the task of coffee, joy accompanied me as I walked.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all, there is only the meaning we each give to our life, an individual meaning, an individual plot, like an individual novel, a book for each person.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: I will not be just a tourist in the world of images, just watching images passing by which I cannot live in, make love to, possess as permanent sources of joy and ecstasy.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Our life is composed greatly from dreams, from the unconscious, and they must be brought into connection with action. They must be woven together.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: The human father has to be confronted and recognized as human, as man who created a child and then, by his absence, left the child fatherless and then Godless.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: The dream was always running ahead of me. To catch up, to live for a moment in unison with it, that was the miracle.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: There are many ways to be free. One of them is to transcend reality by imagination, as I try to do.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Truth is something which can't be told in a few words. Those who simplify the universe only reduce the expansion of its meaning.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: I stopped loving my father a long time ago. What remained was the slavery to a pattern.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: My ideas usually come not at my desk writing but in the midst of living.
values.author: Anais Nin
values.authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

values.authorQuote: Every good citizen makes his country's honor his own, and cherishes it not only as precious but as sacred. He is willing to risk his life in its defense and is conscious that he gains protection while he gives it.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Heaven will be no heaven to me if I do not meet my wife there.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Take time to deliberate; but when the time for action arrives, stop thinking and go in.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: You must pay the price if you wish to secure the blessing.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: The brave man inattentive to his duty, is worth little more to his country than the coward who deserts in the hour of danger.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: The duty of government is to leave commerce to its own capital and credit as well as all other branches of business, protecting all in their legal pursuits, granting exclusive privileges to none.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is having lots to do and not doing it.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: It is to be regretted that the rich and powerful too often bend the acts of government to their own selfish purposes.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: The planter, the farmer, the mechanic, and the laborer... form the great body of the people of the United States, they are the bone and sinew of the country men who love liberty and desire nothing but equal rights and equal laws.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Any man worth his salt will stick up for what he believes right, but it takes a slightly better man to acknowledge instantly and without reservation that he is in error.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: I've got big shoes to fill. This is my chance to do something. I have to seize the moment.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Our government is founded upon the intelligence of the people. I for one do not despair of the republic. I have great confidence in the virtue of the great majority of the people, and I cannot fear the result.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: I have always been afraid of banks.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Peace, above all things, is to be desired, but blood must sometimes be spilled to obtain it on equable and lasting terms.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Elevate those guns a little lower.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Democracy shows not only its power in reforming governments, but in regenerating a race of men and this is the greatest blessing of free governments.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: All the rights secured to the citizens under the Constitution are worth nothing, and a mere bubble, except guaranteed to them by an independent and virtuous Judiciary.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: The great constitutional corrective in the hands of the people against usurpation of power, or corruption by their agents is the right of suffrage; and this when used with calmness and deliberation will prove strong enough.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Americans are not a perfect people, but we are called to a perfect mission.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: Fear not, the people may be deluded for a moment, but cannot be corrupted.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: There are no necessary evils in government. Its evils exist only in its abuses.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: We are beginning a new era in our government. I cannot too strongly urge the necessity of a rigid economy and an inflexible determination not to enlarge the income beyond the real necessities of the government.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: As long as our government is administered for the good of the people, and is regulated by their will; as long as it secures to us the rights of persons and of property, liberty of conscience and of the press, it will be worth defending.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: The people are the government, administering it by their agents; they are the government, the sovereign power.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: War is a blessing compared with national degradation.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: I weep for the liberty of my country when I see at this early day of its successful experiment that corruption has been imputed to many members of the House of Representatives, and the rights of the people have been bartered for promises of office.
values.author: Andrew Jackson
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
values.authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

values.authorQuote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Isn't life a series of images that change as they repeat themselves?
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: In the future, everyone will be famous for 15 minutes.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Being born is like being kidnapped. And then sold into slavery.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Art is what you can get away with.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: If you're not trying to be real, you don't have to get it right. That's art.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I'm for mechanical art. When I took up silk screening, it was to more fully exploit the preconceived image through the commercial techniques of multiple reproduction.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: My fascination with letting images repeat and repeat - or in film's case 'run on' - manifests my belief that we spend much of our lives seeing without observing.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Everyone needs a fantasy.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Sex is more exciting on the screen and between the pages than between the sheets.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: The most exciting attractions are between two opposites that never meet.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: What's great about this country is that America started the tradition where the richest consumers buy essentially the same things as the poorest. You can be watching TV and see Coca-Cola, and you can know that the President drinks Coke. Liz Taylor drinks Coke, and just think, you can drink Coke, too.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Before I was shot, I always thought that I was more half-there than all-there - I always suspected that I was watching TV instead of living life. Right when I was being shot and ever since, I knew that I was watching television.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I am a deeply superficial person.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I'd asked around 10 or 15 people for suggestions. Finally one lady friend asked the right question, 'Well, what do you love most?' That's how I started painting money.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I like to work when I'm not working - do something that may not be considered work, but to me it's work. Getting exercise by going to the grocery store.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: People sometimes say the way things happen in the movies is unreal, but actually, it's the way things happen to you in life that's unreal.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Human beings are born solitary, but everywhere they are in chains - daisy chains - of interactivity. Social actions are makeshift forms, often courageous, sometimes ridiculous, always strange. And in a way, every social action is a negotiation, a compromise between 'his,' 'her' or 'their' wish and yours.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I have Social Disease. I have to go out every night. If I stay home one night I start spreading rumors to my dogs.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Dying is the most embarrassing thing that can ever happen to you, because someone's got to take care of all your details.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I just happen to like ordinary things. When I paint them, I don't try to make them extraordinary. I just try to paint them ordinary-ordinary.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I think everybody should like everybody.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I want to die with my blue jeans on.
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: I never understood why when you died, you didn't just vanish, everything could just keep going on the way it was only you just wouldn't be there. I always thought I'd like my own tombstone to be blank. No epitaph, and no name. Well, actually, I'd like it to say 'figment.'
values.author: Andy Warhol

values.authorQuote: Jails and prisons are designed to break human beings, to convert the population into specimens in a zoo - obedient to our keepers, but dangerous to each other.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: As a black woman, my politics and political affiliation are bound up with and flow from participation in my people's struggle for liberation, and with the fight of oppressed people all over the world against American imperialism.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: I think the importance of doing activist work is precisely because it allows you to give back and to consider yourself not as a single individual who may have achieved whatever but to be a part of an ongoing historical movement.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Racism, in the first place, is a weapon used by the wealthy to increase the profits they bring in by paying Black workers less for their work.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: To understand how any society functions you must understand the relationship between the men and the women.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: You can never stop and as older people, we have to learn how to take leadership from the youth and I guess I would say that this is what I'm attempting to do right now.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Yes, I think it's really important to acknowledge that Dr. King, precisely at the moment of his assassination, was re-conceptualizing the civil rights movement and moving toward a sort of coalitional relationship with the trade union movement.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: What I think is different today is the lack of political connection between the black middle class and the increasing numbers of black people who are more impoverished than ever before.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: I'm involved in the work around prison rights in general.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Radical simply means 'grasping things at the root.'
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: What this country needs is more unemployed politicians.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: I think that has to do with my awareness that in a sense we all have a certain measure of responsibility to those who have made it possible for us to take advantage of the opportunities.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Well I teach in the History of Consciousness Department at the University of California, Santa Cruz. So that's my primary work. I lecture on various campuses and in various communities across the country and other parts of the world.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: It's true that it's within the realm of cultural politics that young people tend to work through political issues, which I think is good, although it's not going to solve the problems.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: But at the same time you can't assume that making a difference 20 years ago is going to allow you to sort of live on the laurels of those victories for the rest of your life.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Had it not been for slavery, the death penalty would have likely been abolished in America. Slavery became a haven for the death penalty.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: In a sense the quest for the emancipation of black people in the U.S. has always been a quest for economic liberation which means to a certain extent that the rise of black middle class would be inevitable.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: My name became known because I was, one might say accidentally the target of state repression and because so many people throughout the country and other parts of the world organized around the demand for my freedom.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: We have to talk about liberating minds as well as liberating society.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Poor people, people of color - especially are much more likely to be found in prison than in institutions of higher education.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: We know the road to freedom has always been stalked by death.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: The work of the political activist inevitably involves a certain tension between the requirement that position be taken on current issues as they arise and the desire that one's contributions will somehow survive the ravages of time.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: When Bush says democracy, I often wonder what he's referring to.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: I decided to teach because I think that any person who studies philosophy has to be involved actively.
values.author: Angela Davis

values.authorQuote: Well for one, the 13th amendment to the constitution of the US which abolished slavery - did not abolish slavery for those convicted of a crime.
values.author: Angela Davis
