values.authorQuote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.

values.authorQuote: I know of nothing more valuable, when it comes to the all-important virtue of authenticity, than simply being who you are.

values.authorQuote: It's the most exciting thing to watch God work when I've asked him about something, to listen to him and watch him work. It's like this friendship, and it just grows and grows and grows and grows.

values.authorQuote: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.

values.authorQuote: When you are giving people the gospel, you are giving them something to believe, and you have to set the stage for that. You don't just drive up and dump the truck and drive off.

values.authorQuote: There is nothing more fearful for the average person in our society than to stand before a group of people and speak.

values.authorQuote: I am a preacher. I'm involved in many other things, but, mainly, I preach. And I love it!

values.authorQuote: The world has changed and it's going to keep changing, but God never changes; so we are safe when we cling to Him.

values.authorQuote: You and I are, by birth, by nature, and by choice, inwardly depraved, which is to say that we are entirely corrupt. That's not to say that we have no good in us; we do. However, anything good in us has been tainted with evil. It touches everything. Without the redeeming power of Christ we cannot halt our own moral slide.
values.author: Charles R. Swindoll

values.authorQuote: Oh, hour of forgiven sin, moment of perfect pardon, our soul shall never forget you while, within you, life and being find immortality!

values.authorQuote: How sweet it is to learn the Savior's love when nobody else loves us! When friends flee, what a blessed thing it is to see that the Savior does not forsake us but still keeps us and holds us fast and clings to us and will not let us go!

values.authorQuote: I think that is a better thing than thanksgiving: thanks-living. How is this to be done? values.authorQuote: A daily portion is really all we need. We do not need tomorrow's supply, for that day has not yet dawned, and its needs are still unborn.

values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: To me, music shouldn't be ego-driven. When you go out on stage and play songs, it is. But when you're sitting in a room, writing songs, it's a completely different process. It's a completely different place. It's a creative place, a musical place. It has nothing to do with who likes what.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: There's something about losing friends, particularly young people, where it's not something that you get over. I don't believe there's a healing process.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I never wrote music or arranged songs or lyrics when I was under the influence of anything but coffee. That's not gone away.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: What do you think Jesus would twitter, 'Let he who is without sin cast the first stone' or 'Has anyone seen Judas? He was here a minute ago.'
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: If I'm going to go out to be a solo artist, it's because I want to do something different without having to wait on someone else's schedule or hobbies or be limited by other people's prejudices. I'd be kind of stupid not to exercise that.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: What's important is to get into shape and then not to have to worry about it. I don't want to get on stage and not being able to do something. Not being physically fit doesn't work for me.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: The reason there's no modern-day Shakespeare is because he didn't have anything to do except sit in a room with a candle and think.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I can go from one extreme to another, from playing at the Sydney Opera House on the Songbook tour to shows with Soundgarden at Voodoo Fest, all in a week.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: At the end of the day it's the fans who make you who you are.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: When you start your first band and it has an impact on the rest of the world you go through a lot with those guys and you become very protective of that legacy.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: In the United States, workouts tend to focus on body image and how you look. For me, it's really all about the brain.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: There wasn't a key moment when I knew I wanted to quit.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I've had a long career and I want to continue to have a long career. The way to do that is not to go away.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: A true musician, like Johnny Cash, should be able to walk into a room with nothing but an instrument and capture people's attention for two hours.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I was going to be a musician, no matter what it took. I supported myself with blue-collared jobs so I could write music and be in a band and play shows. I even got into an underground art scene. I was going to do whatever.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: Children should always feel like the adults are living in this world to nurture them, to take care of them, to protect them from any bad thing that might come.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I don't get in there and create a character. It's more of a voice that I hear living inside the music.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I'm not usually in a talkative mode.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: Most frontmen are not born hams like David Lee Roth. We're more like Joey Ramone: awkward geeks who somehow find our place in the world on the stage.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: It's great when you play to an audience that knows the words to all your songs, and sings them back to you.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: Rock never meant the same thing to everyone, but when I was growing up in the late seventies, everyone could identify the five, ten bands that formed the center.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: To a degree, rock fans like to live vicariously and they like that, music fans in general, but when indie music sort of came into prominence in the early '90s, a lot of it was TV-driven, too, where if you saw the first Nirvana video, you're looking at three guys that look like people you go to school with.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: 'The Beatles' did whatever they wanted. They were a collection of influences adapted to songs they wanted to write. George Harrison was instrumental in bringing in Indian music. Paul McCartney was a huge Little Richard fan. John Lennon was into minimalist aggressive rock.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: I think it's important for fans to know that but if I'm doing something that inspires me musically then I think it will inspire someone else too.
values.author: Chris Cornell

values.authorQuote: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: I don't get high, but sometimes I wish I did. That way, when I messed up in life I would have an excuse. But right now there's no rehab for stupidity.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: Right now, my job is that I'm like an ambulance chaser. I've got to look for movies with white guys falling out of them.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: Jokes rot. They're not like songs. I always envy singers - Sting is always going to sing 'Roxanne'. But people want to hear new jokes. I've written jokes as good as 'Roxanne', I believe. But I can't tell them again.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: When I hear people talk about juggling, or the sacrifices they make for their children, I look at them like they're crazy, because 'sacrifice' infers that there was something better to do than being with your children.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: I think my best work is when I'm kind of in charge.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: Here's what I knew about doing a play: I knew it would make me a better actor.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: You can only offend me if you mean something to me.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: The key to staying together is making sure you guys like each other and need each other.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: Anything you can suck at should make you nervous.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: Karaoke isn't fair when you're a comedian. The whole idea is to get people laughing and enjoying themselves, and I'm a professional funny guy.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: I've seen women who don't have great relationships with their dads, and it all comes down to this: You have to tell girls you love them every day.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: I used to hang out with grandfather all the time because he used to pick me up from school sometimes, or drive me to my mother's, so I'd be with my grandfather a lot. I used to watch him write his sermons.

values.authorQuote: Charlie Brown is the one person I identify with. C.B. is such a loser. He wasn't even the star of his own Halloween special.
values.author: Chris Rock

values.authorQuote: I live in a neighborhood so bad that you can get shot while getting shot.

values.authorQuote: I'll go back to comedy clubs when they get a real no-camera policy, the same way they did with smoking.

values.authorQuote: No film critic's going to say it, but 'Madagascar 3' is better than 'The Artist.'

values.authorQuote: If you properly clean a room, it gets dirtier before it gets cleaner.

values.authorQuote: I'm an independent, but I got to admit I lean Democratic.

values.authorQuote: Show me one guy or woman as funny as Rodney Dangerfield or as good as George Carlin, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, or Joan Rivers. There are a lot of good comics out there, no doubt, but as far as the quality of the comics goes, I think what you have is a bunch of situational comics.

values.authorQuote: Does having a wife and kids change your act? Yes, but only in the best way. It gives you weight and authority. It also makes you closer to the audience because the audience is married and has kids.

values.authorQuote: The thing that surprised me the most is just how much money women that weren't rich were paying for their hair. When you're in a beauty parlor in Harlem next to abandoned buildings and somebody's paying five grand for a weave, that's a bit much.

values.authorQuote: Black people have been qualified to be president for hundreds of years. George Washington Carver could have been president. I could go on with a list of black men that were qualified to be the president of the United States. So the Obama victory is progress for white people.

values.authorQuote: School shootings were invented by blacks... and stolen by the white man.

values.authorQuote: Now that I have children, I realize taking care of my children is more fun than anything in the whole world.

values.authorQuote: By prevailing over all obstacles and distractions, one may unfailingly arrive at his chosen goal or destination.

values.authorQuote: Following the light of the sun, we left the Old World.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: As soon as I arrived in the Indies, in the first island which I found, I took some of the natives by force, in order that they might learn and might give me information of whatever there is in these parts. And so it was that they soon understood us, and we them, either by speech or by signs, and they have been very serviceable.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: No one should fear to undertake any task in the name of our Saviour, if it is just and if the intention is purely for His holy service.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: But in truth, should I meet with gold or spices in great quantity, I shall remain till I collect as much as possible, and for this purpose I am proceeding solely in quest of them.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: For the execution of the voyage to the Indies, I did not make use of intelligence, mathematics or maps.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: These people are very unskilled in arms... with 50 men they could all be subjected and made to do all that one wished.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: The air soft as that of Seville in April, and so fragrant that it was delicious to breathe it.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: My desire was not to pass any island without taking possession, so that, one having been taken, the same may be said of all.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: Stood off and on during the night, determining not to come to anchor till morning, fearing to meet with shoals; continued our course in the morning; and as the island was found to be six or seven leagues distant, and the tide was against us, it was noon when we arrived there.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: I have come to believe that this is a mighty continent which was hitherto unknown.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: Tomorrow morning before we depart, I intend to land and see what can be found in the neighborhood.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: I saw a boy of the crew purchasing javelins of them with bits of platters and broken glass.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: After having dispatched a meal, I went ashore, and found no habitation save a single house, and that without an occupant; we had no doubt that the people had fled in terror at our approach, as the house was completely furnished.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: The Indians on board said that thence to Cuba was a voyage in their canoes of a day and a half; these being small dug-outs without a sail. Such are their canoes. I departed thence for Cuba, for by the signs the Indians made of its greatness, and of its gold and pearls, I thought that it must be Cipango.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: Gold is a treasure, and he who possesses it does all he wishes to in this world, and succeeds in helping souls into paradise.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: I am a most noteworthy sinner, but I have cried out to the Lord for grace and mercy, and they have covered me completely. I have found the sweetest consolation since I made it my whole purpose to enjoy His marvellous Presence.

values.authorQuote: Their houses are all built in the shape of tents, with very high chimneys.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: There are trees of a thousand sorts, and all have their several fruits; and I feel the most unhappy man in the world not to know them, for I am well assured that they are all valuable. I bring home specimens of them, and also of the land.

values.authorQuote: Each day we understand better what the Indians say, and they us, so that very often we are intelligible to each other.

values.authorQuote: For this purpose I determined to keep an account of the voyage, and to write down punctually every thing we performed or saw from day to day, as will hereafter appear.

values.authorQuote: I ordered each man to be presented with something, as strings of ten or a dozen glass beads apiece, and thongs of leather, all which they estimated highly; those which came on board I directed should be fed with molasses.

values.authorQuote: Sailed this day nineteen leagues, and determined to count less than the true number, that the crew might not be dismayed if the voyage should prove long.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: I found that part of it towards San Salvador extending from north to south five leagues, and the other side which we coasted along, ran from east to west more than ten leagues.
values.author: Christopher Columbus

values.authorQuote: I am not solicitous to examine particularly everything here, which indeed could not be done in fifty years, because my desire is to make all possible discoveries, and return to your Highnesses, if it please our Lord, in April.

values.authorQuote: There are all kinds of stupid people that annoy me but what annoys me most is a lazy argument.

values.authorQuote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are God. values.authorQuote: A good day is one where I can not just read a book, but write a review of it. Maybe today I'll be able to do that. I get for some reason somewhat stronger when the sun starts to go down. Dusk is a good time for me. I'm crepuscular.

values.authorQuote: It is the experiences, the great triumphant joy of living to the fullest extent in which real meaning is found. God it's great to be alive!

values.authorQuote: Happiness is only real when shared.

values.authorQuote: At its best, life is completely unpredictable.

values.authorQuote: I try not to worry about things I can't do anything about.

values.authorQuote: I don't know why people eat so badly. I could eat pasta all the time, but it really is fattening. And I love ice cream, but I can't do that. There was a time, until I was in my mid-forties, when I could eat a whole pizza - and really, no effect.
values.author: Christopher Walken

values.authorQuote: Yeah, well I've always played comedy. My background is musical comedy theatre and that's really where my training is. As an actor, that's my training.

values.authorQuote: My background is in musical comedy. I didn't know I was going to be an actor. But all my points of reference have to do with musical comedy and in being kind of a showoff.

values.authorQuote: You know, there's nothing you can do about your public image. It is what it is. I just try to do things honestly. I guess honesty is what you would call subjective: if you feel good about what you're doing, yourself, if you figure you're doing the right thing.

values.authorOccupation: Actor, dancer, business investor with Tribeca Grill

values.authorQuote: My hair was famous before I was.

values.authorQuote: I like cats a lot. I've always liked cats. They're great company. When they eat, they always leave a little bit at the bottom of the bowl. A dog will polish the bowl, but a cat always leaves a little bit. It's like an offering.

values.authorOccupation: Actor, dancer, business investor with Tribeca Grill

values.authorQuote: I'd love to do a character with a wife, a nice little house, a couple of kids, a dog, maybe a bit of singing, and no guns and no killing, but nobody offers me those kind of parts.

values.authorQuote: I remember that. I was talking to him and I said how great it would be if actors had a tail because I have animals and a tail is so expressive. On a cat you can tell everything. You can tell if they're annoyed. You can tell whether they're scared.

values.authorQuote: I think that weddings have probably been crashed since the beginning of time. Cavemen crashed them. You go to meet girls. It makes sense.

values.authorQuote: I'm not much of an analyzer or a psychologist.

values.authorQuote: Because if I don't know my lines, I really don't know what I'm doing.

values.authorQuote: No, improvising is wonderful. But, the thing is that you cannot improvise unless you know exactly what you're doing.

values.authorQuote: I think early on I knew what I was going to do and it was based a lot on familiarity but it was also because I didn't have a lot of skills. There was nothing I wanted t be. I didn't want to be a doctor. I wanted to be in show business.

values.authorQuote: When you're onstage and you know you're bombing, that's very, very scary. Because you know you gotta keep going - you're bombing, but you can't stop. And you know that half an hour from now, you're still gonna be bombing. It takes a thick skin.

values.authorQuote: I was never a child actor. I was a child performer.
values.author: Christopher Walken
values.authorOccupation: Actor, dancer, business investor with Tribeca Grill

values.authorQuote: I'm in a place in my life where I get offered parts that I didn't get offered before - fathers and uncles and grandfathers and so on. And it took me a long time to get to that place, but I'm glad because it opens up new territory.
values.author: Christopher Walken
values.authorOccupation: Actor, dancer, business investor with Tribeca Grill

values.authorQuote: It's interesting - a lot of good actors are good mimes. But I'm terrible. If I tried to do an impression, nobody would know what I was doing.
values.author: Christopher Walken
values.authorOccupation: Actor, dancer, business investor with Tribeca Grill

values.authorQuote: Our Generation has had no Great war, no Great Depression. Our war is spiritual. Our depression is our lives.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: The unreal is more powerful than the real, because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it, because it's only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles, wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: To merely observe your culture without contributing to it seems very close to existing as a ghost.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Where would Jesus be if no one had written the gospels?
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: I try to forget about the expectation that's out there and the audience listening for the next thing so that I'm not trying to please them. I've spent a huge amount of time not communicating with those folks and denying that they exist.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: You have a choice. Live or die. Every breath is a choice. Every minute is a choice. To be or not to be.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: In 'Diary,' the motto really is: 'Where Do You Get Your Inspiration?' It coaches us to be aware of our motives and not just be a reaction to the circumstances around us.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: People used what they called a telephone because they hated being close together and they were scared of being alone.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: We all die. The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: No matter how much you think you love somebody, you'll step back when the pool of their blood edges up too close.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: People have to really suffer before they can risk doing what they love.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: People don't want their lives fixed. Nobody wants their problems solved. Their dramas. Their distractions. Their stories resolved. Their messed cleaned up. Because what would they have left? Just the big scary unknown.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Men are destroyed for being rebellious, and women destroy themselves by failing to be rebellious. Unless you can make that next jump to either getting along with people or resisting people, you are ultimately destroying yourself.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: What we don't understand we can make mean anything.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Only through destroying myself can I discover the greater power of my spirit.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: If you take my stuff apart, you'll find my choruses of repetitions are picked up almost verbatim from Kurt Vonnegut, and my distanced fracture quality is all from Amy Hempel, who's probably my favourite writer.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Some of the best ideas I get seem to happen when I'm doing mindless manual labor or exercise. I'm not sure how that happens, but it leaves me free for remarkable ideas to occur.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Nobody's told me anything to date that I've been completely reviled by.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: My publisher's been shipping me to comic-cons, and it seems that my readership overlaps perfectly with the comic-con crowd.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Men want to make the best use of time and want to see how something can inform them and give them a stronger sense of power.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: What is the real purpose behind the Tooth Fairy, the Easter Bunny and Santa Claus? They seem like greater steps toward faith and imagination, each with a payoff. Like cognitive training exercises.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: I wouldn't get nearly as many books written if I lived in New York. The Columbia Gorge is fantastic. When the sun shines, I just want to be outdoors.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Mr. Olsen in the fifth grade made me want to be a writer. He said, 'Chuck, you do this really well. And this is much better than setting fires, so keep it up.' That made me a writer.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: The best thing about getting a flu shot is that you never again need to wash your hands. That's how I see it.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Sticking feathers up your butt does not make you a chicken.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: Sometimes you do something, and you get screwed. Sometimes it's the things you don't do, and you get screwed.
values.author: Chuck Palahniuk

values.authorQuote: True patriotism hates injustice in its own land more than anywhere else.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: History repeats itself, and that's one of the things that's wrong with history.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: I do not consider it an insult, but rather a compliment to be called an agnostic. I do not pretend to know where many ignorant men are sure - that is all that agnosticism means.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: The world is made up for the most part of morons and natural tyrants, sure of themselves, strong in their own opinions, never doubting anything.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: I have never killed a man, but I have read many obituaries with great pleasure.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: I have suffered from being misunderstood, but I would have suffered a hell of a lot more if I had been understood.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: I do not pretend to know where many ignorant men are sure - that is all that agnosticism means.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: The trouble with law is lawyers.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: No other offense has ever been visited with such severe penalties as seeking to help the oppressed.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: The law does not pretend to punish everything that is dishonest. That would seriously interfere with business.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: I am a friend of the working man, and I would rather be his friend, than be one.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: You can only be free if I am free.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: Laws should be like clothes. They should be made to fit the people they serve.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat tails.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: You can only protect your liberties in this world by protecting the other man's freedom.
values.author: Clarence Darrow

values.authorQuote: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President; I'm beginning to believe it.
values.author: Clarence Darrow
